ArtTap UI/UX Patterns

Bulma.io prototypes

What is this website

This is an ArtTap UI/UX design pattern library for review and comment. The pages should capture the UI interactions, behaviors, layout, and responsivity.

This is starting with the Bulma.io flexbox framework. Why is Walter starting with Bulma?

Github repo for this site (you'll need an invitation from @wflaschka).

ArtTap style guide 20170329.

Site dependencies: Git, Node, Gulp, Sass (scss), Browsersync.io, CSS, Flexbox HTML, Bulma.io, Javascript, JQuery, various Sass mixins

Optimization notes: When it's time, animate.scss can be greatly trimmed.

Why Bulma as a CSS framework?

It's pretty neat

  • Benefits
    • Very simple but comprehensive
    • Based on flex-box which is successor to old-fashioned CSS
    • Can function alongside other CSS frameworks because it does not style unclassed objects (with work; must add bulma scope to css)
    • Minimal: Learn it in a day
    • Incredibly responsive
    • Not opinionated; we can customize it easily
    • Competitive with larger, more opinionated frameworks like Bootstrap and Semantic-UI
    • CSS-only, no built-in JS framework requirements to adapt or integrate
    • Does not look like Bootstrap
  • Drawbacks
    • Default for 3rd party packages is Bootstrap which is used everywhere. Each new integration requires a bit of simplification and removing of excess markup to get it ready for Bulma
    • No built-in JS means some JS coding for UI/UX (turning out to be a good thing so far -- wf 201703)
    • Flexbox approach means some SCSS mixins or other libraries for older CSS won't work as expected

Examples of layouts made with Bulma.
